item.title: Report E-2025010137
item.description:
Report E-2025010137

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-13
  • City: WEST SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 13, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of paint to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pails were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025010126
item.description:
Report E-2025010126

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USJ experienced a UN3267 35 High Mod LV- Part B release from (40) 2-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to multiple 6” x 6” areas of the wood trailer floor The pails were leaking from the seams of the lids, handles, and base due to defective packaging. All pails were containerized into (2) 85-gallon poly drums. The impacted areas were cleaned with absorbents which were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2025010607
item.description:
Report X-2025010607

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: EUREKA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Jan 3rd a package was discovered during the AM sort that felt suspiciously like 3 aerosol cans. DG Admin was notified and directed the station to open the package. Inside the package were 3 aerosol hair spray cans. There are no markings on the outside of the package indicating that it contained dangerous goods. The package is being held pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report E-2025010125
item.description:
Report E-2025010125

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal ULA experienced a UN1789 Clean Up Lime and Scale Remover release from a box containing (2) 2.5-gallon plastic pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed there was approximately 2-gallons of product impacted the trailer floor in a 20’ x 4’ area due to improper blocking & bracing of the cargo. The contractors neutralized the impacted floor with sodium bicarbonate. The contractors containerized (2) 2.5-gallon plastic pails of Lime and Scale Remover into (1) 55-gallon poly drum, neutralized absorbents and pallet pieces were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report E-2025010128
item.description:
Report E-2025010128

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: HAYWARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:59 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a damaged package and product residue at terminal UOA. It was reported that approximately 0.5 gallons of Convoclean Forte released from two 1-gallon plastic bottles due to damage caused by improper loading due by previous terminal. Caller stated the release was contained to the cardboard box and has dried. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of placing the impacted box and contents into a recovery drum. Waste label 223530-1 was created, one 65-gallon poly drum containing two carboard boxes, each containing one 1-gallon plastic jug and protective gloves.

item.title: Report E-2025010105
item.description:
Report E-2025010105

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 8, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured and released approximately the full contents to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remove all released product. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report X-2025010357

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-07
  • City: PICO RIVERA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF operation supervisor states that they unloading trailer 87402 in dock door 56 when they found a 3300lb metal tote of UN2920, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, FLAMMABLE, N.O.S. (AMINE COMPOUND, METHANOL), 8(3), PG II, FLASHPOINT 56 C CLOSED leaking less than 1 fl oz from the top which would need a reseal or replacement tote in order to keep traveling. ABF supervisor states that he's not sure on how the top started leaking but assumes damage happened to the valve.

item.title: Report X-2025010407
item.description:
Report X-2025010407

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER IN THE SORT AISLE AT SPACE 48 USING THE DECISION TREE, THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE SLIDE, NO CLEAN UP, THE PACKAGE WAS SORTED TO THE SORT AISLE BY EMPLOYEE IN THE UNLOAD, RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE AND OPENED IT UP, THERE WERE 4-1GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF TECHSPRAY ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP, RESPONDER PROCESED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP

item.title: Report X-2025010382
item.description:
Report X-2025010382

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-02
  • City: VAN NUYS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF HAZMAT SPILL AT PENN 4 SPLIT 0530AM PST. HAZMAT RESPONDEDER DAWNED APPROPRIATE GEAR AND RESPONDED. INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE REVEALED HAZMAT SHIPPING PAPERS WITH CORROSIVE DESIGNATION. PACKAGE OBSERVED WET ON TOP AND BOTTOM OF PACKAGING BOX. HAZMAT NOT SEEPING OUT OF SHIPPING CONTAINER. REMOVED HAZMAT FROM AREA NO SPILLAGE SEEN IN AREA. TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. OPENED PACKAGE AND OBSERVED CRACKED LID ON A 1 GALLON JUG. TESTED SOLUTION WITH A PH OF 11 PER COLOR CODED CHART. NEUTRALIZED HAZMAT USING SODIUM BICARBONATE IN ITS OWN PLASTIC CONTAINER. RETESTED SOLUTION 2 TIMES TO VERIFY A PH OF 6. USED A SPILL TRAY LINED WITH PLASTIC BAG AND ZEB ZORBENT AND WOODEN MIXING STICK TO SOLIDIFY SOLUTION. ONCE SOLIDIFIED PUT INITIAL PLASTIC BAG WITH SOLIDIFIED SOLUTION, GLOVES, STIRRING STICK, CARDBOARD PACKAGING, GLOVESS, AND PLASTIC JUG IN GREEN HAZMAT BAG. GOOSE NECKED BAG TAPED AND BEGAN HAZMAT PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025010089
item.description:
Report E-2025010089

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: PACOIMA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:10 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal UFV. It was reported that approximately 2 cups of Pan Tint 61W862RS released from one 5-gallon metal jug due to being crushed while in transit due to improper packaging. The release impacted trailer #3110364. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste label 223403-1 was created, one 10-gallon poly drum containing 5-gallon metal jug, plastic wrap and cleaned up product. Chemtrec has been notified, report number 2024121300089 was given by Alex.
